Here's a detailed guide for completing the GCP foundation setup through the console:

# GCP Foundation Setup Guide

## 1. Organization Setup
- Ensure your organization is created (already done)
- Navigate to IAM & Admin > Organization Settings
- Verify domain ownership is confirmed
- Set recovery contact information if prompted

## 2. Users and Groups Setup
- Navigate to IAM & Admin > Groups
- Create the following essential groups (if they don't exist):
  * gcp-organization-admins@taey.ai
  * gcp-billing-admins@taey.ai
  * gcp-security-admins@taey.ai
  * gcp-network-admins@taey.ai
- Add appropriate members to each group including yourself

## 3. Administrative Access
- Navigate to IAM & Admin > IAM
- Ensure your account has Organization Administrator role
- Grant roles to groups:
  * Organization Admins: "Organization Administrator" 
  * Billing Admins: "Billing Account Administrator"
  * Security Admins: "Security Admin" 
  * Network Admins: "Network Admin"

## 4. Billing
- Verify billing is enabled for your project
- Navigate to Billing > Account Management
- Ensure the project is linked to an active billing account
- Check that billing permissions are properly assigned

## 5. Hierarchy & Access
- Navigate to IAM & Admin > Manage Resources
- Verify the project appears under the correct organization
- Create resource hierarchy if needed (folders for environments)

## 6. Security
- Navigate to Security > Settings
- Review and enable essential security features
- Set organization security policies
- Set up Security Command Center (Basic tier is fine)

## 7. Central Logging & Monitoring
- Navigate to Logging > Log Explorer
- Verify logging is enabled
- Navigate to Monitoring > Overview
- Set up basic monitoring dashboard
- Enable notification channels if needed

## 8. VPC Networks
- Navigate to VPC Network > VPC networks
- Create "palios-taey-network" if it doesn't exist
- Configure with auto-mode or custom subnet
- Create "palios-taey-subnet" with CIDR range 10.0.0.0/24

## 9. Service Accounts Setup
- Navigate to IAM & Admin > Service Accounts
- Create these service accounts:
  * palios-taey-admin-sa@palios-taey-dev.iam.gserviceaccount.com
  * palios-taey-cloudrun-sa@palios-taey-dev.iam.gserviceaccount.com
  * palios-taey-firestore-sa@palios-taey-dev.iam.gserviceaccount.com
- Grant appropriate roles to each

## 10. API Enablement
- Navigate to APIs & Services > Library
- Search for and enable:
  * Cloud Resource Manager API
  * Identity and Access Management (IAM) API
  * Service Usage API
  * Cloud Billing API
  * Firestore API
  * Cloud Run API
  * Artifact Registry API
  * Cloud Build API
  * Compute Engine API

## 11. Firestore Setup
- Navigate to Firestore
- Create database in Native mode
- Select location: us-central

## 12. Storage Setup
- Navigate to Cloud Storage > Buckets
- Create bucket "palios-taey-dev-terraform-state"
- Set location to "us-central1"
- Enable versioning
- Set appropriate access controls

## 13. Cloud Run Preparation
- Navigate to Cloud Run
- Verify Cloud Run API is enabled
- Check service account permissions

## 14. Artifact Registry Setup
- Navigate to Artifact Registry
- Create repository "palios-taey"
- Set format to "Docker"
- Set location to "us-central1"

## Verification Steps
- Run a simple command to verify permissions are working:
```bash
gcloud projects describe palios-taey-dev
```
- Verify you can create resources:
```bash
gcloud artifacts repositories list --project=palios-taey-dev
```

After completing these steps, you should have a properly configured GCP foundation that will support all the deployment activities we've planned. Once verified, proceed with the file creation and deployment steps from our previous discussion.
